bibl.title: Letter from William Houston Lazear and Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, [March 24, 1908]

div1.p: William Lazear writes about buying skates, and Mabel Lazear informs Sweitzer that she is awaiting news on a possible increase in her pension.

div1.head: Letter from William Houston Lazear and Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, [March 24, 1908]
div1.p:
I took
four of the
dollar that
you gave me
to buy some
skates. We
think we will
go away for
a week. I got
a new suit
of clothes.

I am going
to shoot wh-
we are away.
We have vac-
ation soon.
div1.closer:
Love
from Houston.
P.S.- I have just read this
letter of Houston - the shooting
part I don't believe you
will appreciate - I think
we will postpone that.-
mother will go on the
8th of April - and we
may go some place just
near here but not
until the eleventh of
April.
Jim said there was a
very fine article in the
Transcript about Jess- we
will try to get it- I hope
your stay in Baltimore will
do you good- Love again
Mabel.

div1.p:
Houston
wrote his letter to
you on Sunday and
To-day he was much
pleased to hear yours.

You can imagine
how anxiously I await
any news from Washing-
ton now that things
have gone well this
far-

I often think about
the summer - and
wish you could see more
of the children-

Charlotte Field is coming
here this summer so
that I could ask her
to Take my house and
go East- if you do not
feel able to came to
us- These are only ideas-
Emma goes to-morrow
for a vacation she
says she would like to
stay sometimes - Hope to
hear very soon
